intro: Agropyron erickssonii, commonly known as the ericson's wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and rocky slopes. The plant has slender,丛生 (clumped) growth habit with narrow, blue-green leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are arranged in a loose panicle, producing small, wind-pollinated flowers. Agropyron erickssonii is drought-tolerant and plays a role in stabilizing soils in arid environments.
